member.summary: An event to receive server shutdown notifications. This event can be used by the client so that the server can request that the client should disconnect from the server.

member.name: T:OpcClientSdk.OpcServerState
member.summary: The set of possible server states.

member.name: F:OpcClientSdk.OpcServerState.Unknown
member.summary: The server state is not known.

member.name: F:OpcClientSdk.OpcServerState.Operational
member.summary: The server is running normally. This is the usual state for a server

member.name: F:OpcClientSdk.OpcServerState.Faulted
member.summary: The server is not operational due to a fault. The server is no longer functioning. The recovery procedure from this situation is vendor specific. An error code of E_FAIL should generally be returned from any other server method.

member.name: F:OpcClientSdk.OpcServerState.NeedsConfiguration
member.summary: The server is running but has no configuration information loaded and thus cannot function normally. Note this state implies that the server needs configuration information in order to function. Servers which do not require configuration information should not return this state.

member.name: F:OpcClientSdk.OpcServerState.OutOfService
member.summary: The server has been temporarily suspended via some vendor specific method and is not getting or sending data. Note that Quality will be returned as OPC_QUALITY_OUT_OF_SERVICE.

member.name: F:OpcClientSdk.OpcServerState.Diagnostics
member.summary: The server is in Diagnostics Mode. The outputs are disconnected from the real hardware but the server will otherwise behave normally. Inputs may be real or may be simulated depending on the vendor implementation. Quality will generally be returned normally.

member.name: F:OpcClientSdk.OpcServerState.NotConnected
member.summary: The server is not operational. The outputs are disconnected from the real hardware but the server will otherwise behave normally. Inputs may be real or may be simulated depending on the vendor implementation. Quality will generally be returned normally.

member.name: F:OpcClientSdk.OpcServerState.Initializing
member.summary: The server is not operational because it is starting up.

member.name: F:OpcClientSdk.OpcServerState.Aborting
member.summary: The server is operational but it is shutting down and aborting all of its client contexts.

member.name: F:OpcClientSdk.OpcServerState.NotOperational
member.summary: The server is not operational, but the reason is not known.

member.name: F:OpcClientSdk.OpcResult.CO_E_CLASSSTRING
member.summary: Invalid class string (Return Code: 0x800401F3).

member.name: F:OpcClientSdk.OpcResult.CO_E_OBJNOTCONNECTED
member.summary: The object application has been disconnected from the remoting system (Return Code: 0x800401FD).

member.name: F:OpcClientSdk.OpcResult.CONNECT_E_NOCONNECTION
member.summary: Cannot Unadvise - there is no existing connection (Return Code: 0x80040200).

member.name: F:OpcClientSdk.OpcResult.E_ABORT
member.summary: Return Code: 0x80004004

member.name: F:OpcClientSdk.OpcResult.E_ACCESS_DENIED
member.summary: The server denies access (Return Code: 0x80070005).

member.name: F:OpcClientSdk.OpcResult.E_FAIL
member.summary: The function was unsuccessfull (Return Code: 0x80004005).

member.name: F:OpcClientSdk.OpcResult.E_INVALIDARG
member.summary: The value of one or more parameters was not valid. This is generally used in place of a more specific error where it is expected that problems are unlikely or will be easy to identify (for example when there is only one parameter) (Return Code: 0x80070057).

member.name: F:OpcClientSdk.OpcResult.E_NETWORK_ERROR
member.summary: General network error.

member.name: F:OpcClientSdk.OpcResult.E_NOINTERFACE
member.summary: The interface asked for is not supported by the server (Return Code: 0x80004002).

member.name: F:OpcClientSdk.OpcResult.E_NOTIMPL
member.summary: Function is not implemented (Return Code: 0x80004001).

member.name: F:OpcClientSdk.OpcResult.E_NOTSUPPORTED
member.summary: The server does not support the requested function with the specified parameters.

member.name: F:OpcClientSdk.OpcResult.E_OUTOFMEMORY
member.summary: Not enough memory to complete the requested operation. This can happen any time the server needs to allocate memory to complete the requested operation (Return Code: 0x8007000E).

member.name: F:OpcClientSdk.OpcResult.E_POINTER
member.summary: NULL pointer argument.

member.name: F:OpcClientSdk.OpcResult.E_TIMEDOUT
member.summary: The operation took too long to complete.

member.name: F:OpcClientSdk.OpcResult.S_FALSE
member.summary: The function completed with an error (Return Code: 0x00000001).

member.name: F:OpcClientSdk.OpcResult.S_OK
member.summary: The function was successfull (Return Code: 0x00000000).

member.name: F:OpcClientSdk.OpcResult.Da.S_DATAQUEUEOVERFLOW
member.summary: Indicates that not every detected change has been returned for this item. This is an indicator that servers buffer reached its limit and had to purge out the oldest data. Only the most recent data is provided. The server should only remove the oldest data for those items that have newer samples available in the buffer. This will allow single samplings of older items to be returned to the client (Return Code: 0x00040404).

member.summary: The server does not support the requested data rate but will use the closest available rate (Return Code: 0x0004000D).

member.summary: The server for which the status is being reported. The ServerType enumeration is used to identify the server. If the enumeration indicates multiple server types, then this is the status of the entire server. For example, if the server wraps an OPC DA and OPC AE server, then if this ServerType indicates both, the status is for the entire server, and not for an individual wrapped server.

member.summary: The server is running normally. This is the usual state for a server

member.name: F:OpcClientSdk.Ae.TsCAeServerState.Failed
member.summary: A vendor specific fatal error has occurred within the server. The server is no longer functioning. The recovery procedure from this situation is vendor specific. An error code of E_FAIL should generally be returned from any other server method.

member.name: F:OpcClientSdk.Ae.TsCAeServerState.NoConfig
member.summary: The server is running but has no configuration information loaded and thus cannot function normally. Note this state implies that the server needs configuration information in order to function. Servers which do not require configuration information should not return this state.

member.name: F:OpcClientSdk.Ae.TsCAeServerState.Suspended
member.summary: The server has been temporarily suspended via some vendor specific method and is not getting or sending data. Note that Quality will be returned as OPC_QUALITY_OUT_OF_SERVICE.

member.name: F:OpcClientSdk.Ae.TsCAeServerState.Test
member.summary: The server is in Test Mode. The outputs are disconnected from the real hardware but the server will otherwise behave normally. Inputs may be real or may be simulated depending on the vendor implementation. Quality will generally be returned normally.

member.name: F:OpcClientSdk.Ae.TsCAeServerState.CommFault
member.summary: The server is in Test Mode. The outputs are disconnected from the real hardware but the server will otherwise behave normally. Inputs may be real or may be simulated depending on the vendor implementation. Quality will generally be returned normally.

member.name: P:OpcClientSdk.Ae.TsCAeCondition.AcknowledgerID
member.summary: This is the ID of the client who last acknowledged this condition. This value is null if the condition has never been acknowledged.

member.name: P:OpcClientSdk.Ae.TsCAeCondition.ActiveSubCondition
member.summary: The currently active sub-condition, for multi-state conditions which are active. For a single-state condition, this contains the information about the condition itself. For inactive conditions, this value is null.

member.name: P:OpcClientSdk.Ae.TsCAeCondition.Attributes
member.summary: The values of the attributes requested for this condition.

member.name: P:OpcClientSdk.Ae.TsCAeCondition.Comment
member.summary: The comment string passed in by the client who last acknowledged this condition. This value is null if the condition has never been acknowledged.

member.name: P:OpcClientSdk.Ae.TsCAeCondition.CondLastActive
member.summary: Time of the most recent transition into the condition. There may be transitions among the sub-conditions which are more recent. If the condition has never been active, this value is DateTime.MinValue. The OpcBase.TimeAsUTC property defines the time format (UTC or local time).

member.name: P:OpcClientSdk.Ae.TsCAeCondition.CondLastInactive
member.summary: Time of the most recent transition out of this condition. This value is DateTime.MinValue if the condition has never been active, or if it is currently active for the first time and has never been exited. The OpcBase.TimeAsUTC property defines the time format (UTC or local time).

member.name: P:OpcClientSdk.Ae.TsCAeCondition.LastAckTime
member.summary: The time of the most recent acknowledgment of this condition (of any sub-condition). The OpcBase.TimeAsUTC property defines the time format (UTC or local time).

member.name: P:OpcClientSdk.Ae.TsCAeCondition.Quality
member.summary: The quality associated with the condition state.

member.name: P:OpcClientSdk.Ae.TsCAeCondition.State
member.summary: A bit mask indicating the current state of the condition

member.name: P:OpcClientSdk.Ae.TsCAeCondition.SubConditions
member.summary: The sub-conditions defined for this condition. For single-state conditions, the collection will contain one element, the value of which describes the condition.

member.name: P:OpcClientSdk.Ae.TsCAeCondition.SubCondLastActive
member.summary: Time of the most recent transition into active sub-condition. This is the time value which must be specified when acknowledging the condition. If the condition has never been active, this value is DateTime.MinValue. The OpcBase.TimeAsUTC property defines the time format (UTC or local time).

summary.para: Defines possible item engineering unit types

member.summary: No engineering unit information available

member.summary: Analog engineering unit - will contain a SAFEARRAY of exactly two doubles (VT_ARRAY | VT_R8) corresponding to the LOW and HI EU range.

member.name: F:OpcClientSdk.Da.TsDaEuType.Enumerated
member.summary: Enumerated enginnering unit - will contain a SAFEARRAY of strings (VT_ARRAY | VT_BSTR) which contains a list of strings (Example: “OPEN”, “CLOSE”, “IN TRANSIT”, etc.) corresponding to sequential numeric values (0, 1, 2, etc.)

summary.para: Defines the possible limit status bits.
The Limit Field is valid regardless of the Quality and Substatus. In some cases such as Sensor Failure it can provide useful diagnostic information.

member.name: F:OpcClientSdk.Da.TsDaLimitBits.None
member.summary: The value is free to move up or down

member.name: F:OpcClientSdk.Da.TsDaLimitBits.Low
member.summary: The value has ‘pegged’ at some lower limit

member.name: F:OpcClientSdk.Da.TsDaLimitBits.High
member.summary: The value has ‘pegged’ at some high limit

member.name: F:OpcClientSdk.Da.TsDaLimitBits.Constant
member.summary: The value is a constant and cannot move

summary.para: Defines the possible quality status bits.

These flags represent the quality state for an item's data value. This is intended to be similar to but slightly simpler than the Fieldbus Data Quality Specification (section 4.4.1 in the H1 Final Specifications). This design makes it fairly easy for both servers and client applications to determine how much functionality they want to implement.

member.name: F:OpcClientSdk.Da.TsDaQualityBits.Good
member.summary: The Quality of the value is Good.

member.name: F:OpcClientSdk.Da.TsDaQualityBits.GoodLocalOverride
member.summary: The value has been Overridden. Typically this means the input has been disconnected and a manually entered value has been 'forced'.

member.name: F:OpcClientSdk.Da.TsDaQualityBits.Bad
member.summary: The value is bad but no specific reason is known.

member.name: F:OpcClientSdk.Da.TsDaQualityBits.BadConfigurationError
member.summary: There is some server specific problem with the configuration. For example the item in question has been deleted from the configuration.

member.name: F:OpcClientSdk.Da.TsDaQualityBits.BadNotConnected
member.summary: The input is required to be logically connected to something but is not. This quality may reflect that no value is available at this time, for reasons like the value may have not been provided by the data source.

member.name: F:OpcClientSdk.Da.TsDaQualityBits.BadDeviceFailure
member.summary: A device failure has been detected.

member.name: F:OpcClientSdk.Da.TsDaQualityBits.BadSensorFailure
member.summary: A sensor failure had been detected (the ’Limits’ field can provide additional diagnostic information in some situations).

member.name: F:OpcClientSdk.Da.TsDaQualityBits.BadLastKnownValue
member.summary: Communications have failed. However, the last known value is available. Note that the ‘age’ of the value may be determined from the time stamp in the item state.

member.name: F:OpcClientSdk.Da.TsDaQualityBits.BadCommFailure
member.summary: Communications have failed. There is no last known value is available.

member.name: F:OpcClientSdk.Da.TsDaQualityBits.BadOutOfService
member.summary: The block is off scan or otherwise locked. This quality is also used when the active state of the item or the subscription containing the item is InActive.

member.name: F:OpcClientSdk.Da.TsDaQualityBits.BadWaitingForInitialData
member.summary: After Items are added to a subscription, it may take some time for the server to actually obtain values for these items. In such cases the client might perform a read (from cache), or establish a ConnectionPoint based subscription and/or execute a Refresh on such a subscription before the values are available. This substatus is only available from OPC DA 3.0 or newer servers.

member.name: F:OpcClientSdk.Da.TsDaQualityBits.Uncertain
member.summary: There is no specific reason why the value is uncertain.

member.name: F:OpcClientSdk.Da.TsDaQualityBits.UncertainLastUsableValue
member.summary: Whatever was writing this value has stopped doing so. The returned value should be regarded as ‘stale’. Note that this differs from a BAD value with Substatus badLastKnownValue (Last Known Value). That status is associated specifically with a detectable communications error on a ‘fetched’ value. This error is associated with the failure of some external source to ‘put’ something into the value within an acceptable period of time. Note that the ‘age’ of the value can be determined from the time stamp in the item state.

member.name: F:OpcClientSdk.Da.TsDaQualityBits.UncertainSensorNotAccurate
member.summary: Either the value has ‘pegged’ at one of the sensor limits (in which case the limit field should be set to low or high) or the sensor is otherwise known to be out of calibration via some form of internal diagnostics (in which case the limit field should be none).

member.name: F:OpcClientSdk.Da.TsDaQualityBits.UncertainEUExceeded
member.summary: The returned value is outside the limits defined for this parameter. Note that in this case (per the Fieldbus Specification) the ‘Limits’ field indicates which limit has been exceeded but does NOT necessarily imply that the value cannot move farther out of range.

member.name: F:OpcClientSdk.Da.TsDaQualityBits.UncertainSubNormal
member.summary: The value is derived from multiple sources and has less than the required number of Good sources.

member.summary: Retrieve the average data over the resample interval.

member.summary: Retrieve the number of raw values over the resample interval.

member.summary: Retrieve the difference between the first and last value in the resample interval.

member.summary: Retrieve the duration (in seconds) of time in the interval during which the data is bad.

member.name: F:OpcClientSdk.Hda.TsCHdaAggregateID.DurationGood
member.summary: Retrieve the duration (in seconds) of time in the interval during which the data is good.

member.name: F:OpcClientSdk.Hda.TsCHdaAggregateID.End
member.summary: Retrieve the value at the end of the resample interval. The time stamp is the time stamp of the end of the interval.

member.name: F:OpcClientSdk.Hda.TsCHdaAggregateID.Interpolative
member.summary: Do not retrieve an aggregate. This is used for retrieving interpolated values.

member.name: F:OpcClientSdk.Hda.TsCHdaAggregateID.Maximum
member.summary: Retrieve the maximum value in the resample interval.

member.name: F:OpcClientSdk.Hda.TsCHdaAggregateID.MaximumActualTime
member.summary: Retrieve the maximum value in the resample interval and the timestamp of the maximum value.

member.name: F:OpcClientSdk.Hda.TsCHdaAggregateID.Minimum
member.summary: Retrieve the minimum value in the resample interval.

member.name: F:OpcClientSdk.Hda.TsCHdaAggregateID.MinimumActualTime
member.summary: Retrieve the minimum value in the resample interval and the timestamp of the minimum value.

member.name: F:OpcClientSdk.Hda.TsCHdaAggregateID.NoAggregate
member.summary: Do not retrieve an aggregate.

member.name: F:OpcClientSdk.Hda.TsCHdaAggregateID.PercentBad
member.summary: Retrieve the percent of data (1 equals 100 percent) in the interval which has bad quality.

member.name: F:OpcClientSdk.Hda.TsCHdaAggregateID.PercentGood
member.summary: Retrieve the percent of data (1 equals 100 percent) in the interval which has good quality.

member.name: F:OpcClientSdk.Hda.TsCHdaAggregateID.Range
member.summary: Retrieve the difference between the minimum and maximum value over the sample interval.

member.name: F:OpcClientSdk.Hda.TsCHdaAggregateID.RegConst
member.summary: Retrieve the intercept of the regression line over the resample interval. This is the value of the regression line at the start of the interval.

member.name: F:OpcClientSdk.Hda.TsCHdaAggregateID.RegDev
member.summary: Retrieve the standard deviation of the regression line over the resample interval.

member.name: F:OpcClientSdk.Hda.TsCHdaAggregateID.RegSlope
member.summary: Retrieve the slope of the regression line over the resample interval.

member.name: F:OpcClientSdk.Hda.TsCHdaAggregateID.StandardDeviation
member.summary: Retrieve the standard deviation over the resample interval.

member.name: F:OpcClientSdk.Hda.TsCHdaAggregateID.Start
member.summary: Retrieve the value at the beginning of the resample interval. The time stamp is the time stamp of the beginning of the interval.

member.name: F:OpcClientSdk.Hda.TsCHdaAggregateID.TimeAverage
member.summary: Retrieve the time weighted average data over the resample interval.

member.name: F:OpcClientSdk.Hda.TsCHdaAggregateID.Total
member.summary: Retrieve the totalized value (time integral) of the data over the resample interval.

member.name: F:OpcClientSdk.Hda.TsCHdaAggregateID.Variance
member.summary: Retrieve the variance over the sample interval.

member.name: F:OpcClientSdk.Hda.TsCHdaAggregateID.WorstQuality
member.summary: Retrieve the worst quality of data in the interval.
